description.zh-cn: 唐代诗人兼官员，号称“诗仙”，诗风飘逸奔放，充满浪漫主义情调。其家世存有争议，有蜀地汉人、西域汉人及西域外族等说法。曾获唐玄宗征召为翰林供奉，后因遭排挤而离职。安史之乱时，因加入永王李璘幕府，事败后被流放夜郎，途中遇赦。其诗歌对后世有巨大影响。
description.en: A Tang dynasty poet and official, known as the 'Poet Immortal.' His poetry is characterized by its ethereal and unrestrained style, filled with romanticism. His ancestry is disputed, with theories suggesting he was a Han Chinese from Shu, a Han Chinese from the Western Regions, or of non-Han origin from the Western Regions. He was summoned by Emperor Xuanzong to serve as a Hanlin Academy attendant but later left his post due to political intrigue. During the An Lushan Rebellion, he joined the staff of the Prince of Yong, Li Lin, and was exiled to Yelang after the prince's defeat, but was pardoned en route. His poetry has had a profound influence on later generations.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝在位时间最长的皇帝，前期开创了开元盛世，后期因安史之乱而导致唐朝由盛转衰。
description.en: The longest-reigning emperor of the Tang dynasty. The early part of his reign marked the prosperous Kaiyuan Era, but the latter part saw the dynasty decline due to the An Lushan Rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 唐朝的文学机构，负责起草诏书、为皇帝提供咨询等。
description.en: A literary and academic institution in the Tang dynasty, responsible for drafting imperial edicts and advising the emperor.

description.zh-cn: 唐代的一种官职，多为有才艺者担任，侍奉于皇帝左右。
description.en: An official title in the Tang dynasty, often held by talented individuals who served the emperor.

description.zh-cn: 李白之父。
description.en: Father of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李白的首任妻子，前宰相许圉师的孙女。
description.en: Li Bai's first wife, granddaughter of the former chancellor Xu Yushi.

description.zh-cn: 李白的最后一任妻子，前宰相宗楚客的孙女。
description.en: Li Bai's last wife, granddaughter of the former chancellor Zong Chuke.

description.zh-cn: 唐代宰相，李白妻子宗氏的祖父。
description.en: A chancellor of the Tang dynasty, grandfather of Li Bai's wife, Lady Zong.

description.zh-cn: 李白之子。
description.en: Son of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李白之子。
description.en: Son of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李白之女。
description.en: Daughter of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李白创作的一首五言绝句，是其代表作之一。
description.en: A five-character quatrain written by Li Bai, one of his most representative works.

description.zh-cn: 李白创作的一首乐府诗，是其代表作之一。
description.en: A yuefu poem written by Li Bai, one of his most representative works.

description.zh-cn: 李白创作的一首乐府诗，是其代表作之一。
description.en: A yuefu poem written by Li Bai, one of his most representative works.

en: Leaving Baidi Town Early in the Morning

description.zh-cn: 李白创作的一首七言绝句，是其代表作之一。
description.en: A seven-character quatrain written by Li Bai, one of his most representative works.

description.zh-cn: 唐代的一个州，位于今四川省境内，是李白的成长地。
description.en: A prefecture in the Tang dynasty, located in modern-day Sichuan province, where Li Bai grew up.

description.zh-cn: 唐代绵州下辖的一个县，被认为是李白的出生地之一。
description.en: A county under Mian Prefecture in the Tang dynasty, considered one of Li Bai's possible birthplaces.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗时期权势显赫的宦官。据传曾因李白醉酒命其脱靴而感到被冒犯，进而排挤李白。
description.en: A powerful eunuch during the reign of Emperor Xuanzong of Tang. It is said that he felt offended when a drunken Li Bai ordered him to remove his boots, leading him to ostracize the poet.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗的宠妃。据传因高力士中伤，认为李白在诗中以赵飞燕影射她，因而排斥李白。
description.en: The beloved consort of Emperor Xuanzong of Tang. It is said that due to Gao Lishi's slander, she believed Li Bai alluded to Zhao Feiyan to satirize her in a poem, and thus ostracized him.

description.zh-cn: 唐代的一场大规模叛乱，导致唐朝由盛转衰。李白在此期间因卷入政治斗争而遭遇不幸。
description.en: A large-scale rebellion during the Tang dynasty that marked its turning point from prosperity to decline. Li Bai suffered misfortune during this period due to his involvement in political struggles.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗之子，封永王。安史之乱时起兵，被唐肃宗视为叛乱而剿灭。李白曾应召加入其幕府，因此获罪。
description.en: A son of Emperor Xuanzong of Tang, titled Prince of Yong. He raised an army during the An Lushan Rebellion but was suppressed by Emperor Suzong, who considered it a revolt. Li Bai was implicated for joining his staff.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗之子，安史之乱期间即位。他将永王李璘的起兵视为叛乱，并因此将李白定罪。
description.en: Son of Emperor Xuanzong, who ascended the throne during the An Lushan Rebellion. He regarded Prince of Yong Li Lin's military actions as a rebellion and consequently convicted Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 唐代的一个地区，位于今贵州一带。李白曾被判流放至此。
description.en: A region in the Tang dynasty, located in modern-day Guizhou area. Li Bai was sentenced to exile here.

description.zh-cn: 唐代伟大的现实主义诗人，与李白齐名，并称为“李杜”。
description.en: A great realist poet of the Tang dynasty, equally famous as Li Bai, and they are often referred to as 'Li-Du'.

description.zh-cn: 唐代著名的山水田园派诗人，与李白是好友。
description.en: A famous landscape and pastoral poet of the Tang dynasty, and a friend of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 唐代边塞诗人，曾与李白、杜甫交游。后官至淮南节度使，在李白下狱时未施以援手。
description.en: A frontier poet of the Tang dynasty who associated with Li Bai and Du Fu. He later became the military governor of Huainan and did not offer help when Li Bai was imprisoned.

description.zh-cn: 唐代益州长史，曾称赞年轻的李白“天才英丽，下笔不休”。
description.en: The governor of Yizhou in the Tang dynasty, who praised the young Li Bai for his 'brilliant talent and ceaseless writing'.

description.zh-cn: 唐代诗人、书法家，官至秘书监。他非常欣赏李白的才华，称其为“谪仙人”，其赞誉对李白获得玄宗召见有重要作用。
description.en: A Tang dynasty poet and calligrapher who served as the Director of the Palace Library. He greatly admired Li Bai's talent, calling him a 'banished immortal,' and his praise was instrumental in Li Bai gaining an audience with Emperor Xuanzong.

description.zh-cn: 唐代道士，曾向唐玄宗推荐李白。
description.en: A Daoist priest of the Tang dynasty who recommended Li Bai to Emperor Xuanzong.

description.zh-cn: 唐玄宗的妹妹，信奉道教。曾向唐玄宗推荐李白。
description.en: Sister of Emperor Xuanzong, a devout Daoist. She recommended Li Bai to the emperor.

description.zh-cn: 唐代名士，与李白等人隐居于徂徕山，并称为“竹溪六逸”。
description.en: A renowned scholar of the Tang dynasty who, along with Li Bai and others, lived in seclusion on Mount Culai. They were known as the 'Six Idlers of the Bamboo Brook'.

description.zh-cn: 唐代书法家、官员，李白的族叔。在李白晚年时照顾他，并为其整理诗文，编成《草堂集》。
description.en: A Tang dynasty calligrapher and official, and a clansman (uncle) of Li Bai. He took care of Li Bai in his later years and compiled his poems into the 'Caotang Collection'.

description.zh-cn: 李白诗文集，其早期版本由李阳冰编订。
description.en: The collection of Li Bai's poems and writings, with an early version compiled by Li Yangbing.

description.zh-cn: 唐代名将，在平定安史之乱中功勋卓著。传说他曾受李白救助，后在李白获罪时为其求情。
description.en: A famous general of the Tang dynasty who made great contributions to quelling the An Lushan Rebellion. Legend has it that he was once saved by Li Bai and later pleaded for him when Li Bai was convicted.

description.zh-cn: 唐代道教上清派宗师，曾称赞李白有“仙风道骨”。
description.en: A patriarch of the Shangqing school of Daoism during the Tang dynasty, who praised Li Bai as having the 'air and bone of an immortal'.

description.zh-cn: 中国本土的宗教和哲学传统。李白笃信道教，其诗歌深受道家思想和神仙传说影响。
description.en: An indigenous religious and philosophical tradition of China. Li Bai was a devout follower, and his poetry was deeply influenced by Daoist thought and immortal legends.

description.zh-cn: 南朝齐诗人，以山水诗著称。李白最为敬慕的诗人，其诗风对李白有重要影响。
description.en: A poet of the Southern Qi dynasty, famous for his landscape poetry. He was the poet Li Bai admired most, and his style had a significant influence on Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 李客是李白的父亲。
description.en: Li Ke is Li Bai's father.

description.zh-cn: 李伯禽是李白与许氏所生的儿子。
description.en: Li Boqin is the son of Li Bai and Lady Xu.

description.zh-cn: 李平阳是李白与许氏所生的女儿。
description.en: Li Pingyang is the daughter of Li Bai and Lady Xu.

description.zh-cn: 李天然是李白的儿子。
description.en: Li Tianran is the son of Li Bai.

description.zh-cn: 727年，李白与前宰相许圉师的孙女许氏结婚。
description.en: In 727, Li Bai married Lady Xu, the granddaughter of former chancellor Xu Yushi.

description.zh-cn: 约749年，李白与前宰相宗楚客的孙女宗氏结婚。
description.en: Around 749, Li Bai married Lady Zong, the granddaughter of former chancellor Zong Chuke.

description.zh-cn: 宗氏是宗楚客的孙女。
description.en: Lady Zong is the granddaughter of Zong Chuke.

description.zh-cn: 根据多种记载，李白出生于唐朝绵州彰明县。
description.en: According to multiple records, Li Bai was born in Zhangming County, Mian Prefecture during the Tang dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 742年，李白因其才名获唐玄宗征召入京，出任翰林供奉，但两年后即被赐金放还。
description.en: In 742, Li Bai was summoned to the capital by Emperor Xuanzong due to his fame and appointed as an attendant in the Hanlin Academy, but he was dismissed with a grant of gold two years later.

description.zh-cn: 李白于742年至744年间在翰林院担任供奉官。
description.en: Li Bai served as an Attendant Scholar in the Hanlin Academy from 742 to 744.

description.zh-cn: 贺知章在长安初见李白时，对其诗文大加赞赏，称其为“谪仙人”，使李白名声大振，并引起了唐玄宗的注意。
description.en: When He Zhizhang first met Li Bai in Chang'an, he highly praised his poetry, calling him a 'banished immortal,' which greatly enhanced Li Bai's reputation and brought him to the attention of Emperor Xuanzong.

description.zh-cn: 据传，道士吴筠曾向唐玄宗推荐李白，促成其入京为官。
description.en: It is said that the Daoist priest Wu Yun recommended Li Bai to Emperor Xuanzong, facilitating his appointment to an official post in the capital.

description.zh-cn: 据传，玉真公主曾向其兄长唐玄宗推荐李白。
description.en: It is said that Princess Yuzhen recommended Li Bai to her brother, Emperor Xuanzong.

description.zh-cn: 据传李白曾酒后命高力士为其脱靴，高力士引以为耻，后向杨贵妃进谗言中伤李白，导致李白被排挤出京。
description.en: According to legend, Li Bai once drunkenly ordered Gao Lishi to remove his boots. Gao Lishi, feeling humiliated, later slandered Li Bai to Consort Yang, which led to Li Bai being ostracized from the court.

description.zh-cn: 因高力士进谗言，杨贵妃开始排斥李白，导致李白失去唐玄宗的恩宠。
description.en: Due to Gao Lishi's slander, Consort Yang began to ostracize Li Bai, causing him to lose Emperor Xuanzong's favor.

description.zh-cn: 安史之乱爆发后，李白的生活陷入动荡，并最终因卷入永王李璘事件而获罪。
description.en: After the outbreak of the An Lushan Rebellion, Li Bai's life was thrown into turmoil, and he was eventually convicted for his involvement in the Prince of Yong, Li Lin's affair.

description.zh-cn: 安史之乱期间，李白应聘加入永王李璘的幕府，为其效力。
description.en: During the An Lushan Rebellion, Li Bai accepted an invitation to join the staff of the Prince of Yong, Li Lin.

description.zh-cn: 永王李璘起兵失败后，唐肃宗将李白视为附逆，判其下狱并流放夜郎。
description.en: After the failure of the Prince of Yong, Li Lin's uprising, Emperor Suzong considered Li Bai a traitor, sentencing him to imprisonment and exile to Yelang.

description.zh-cn: 李白与杜甫于744年在洛阳或汴宋一带相识，并一同游历，结下深厚友谊。二人并称“李杜”。
description.en: Li Bai and Du Fu met around 744 in Luoyang or the Bian-Song area, traveled together, and formed a deep friendship. They are collectively known as 'Li-Du'.

description.zh-cn: 李白在襄阳认识了孟浩然，并对其十分敬慕，写下《黄鹤楼送孟浩然之广陵》等诗篇。
description.en: Li Bai met Meng Haoran in Xiangyang and greatly admired him, writing poems such as 'Seeing Meng Haoran Off at Yellow Crane Tower to Guangling'.

description.zh-cn: 744年秋，李白与杜甫、高适在汴州、宋州一带交游。
description.en: In the autumn of 744, Li Bai associated with Du Fu and Gao Shi in the Bianzhou and Songzhou areas.

description.zh-cn: 李白因永王李璘案下狱后，曾向时任淮南节度使的故友高适求救，但未获援手。
description.en: After being imprisoned for his involvement with the Prince of Yong, Li Lin, Li Bai sought help from his old friend Gao Shi, who was then the military governor of Huainan, but received no assistance.

description.zh-cn: 李白去世后，其族叔李阳冰将李白生前托付的诗文手稿编成《草堂集》十卷行世，使李白的作品得以流传。
description.en: After Li Bai's death, his clansman Li Yangbing compiled the manuscripts entrusted to him by the poet into the ten-volume 'Caotang Collection', ensuring the preservation and circulation of Li Bai's works.

description.zh-cn: 传说郭子仪为报答李白早年的救助之恩，在李白因永王案获罪时以自己的官爵为他求情，使李白得以免死，改判流放。
description.en: According to legend, to repay Li Bai for saving him in his early years, Guo Ziyi pleaded for Li Bai when he was convicted in the Prince of Yong affair, using his own official rank as a bargaining chip. This supposedly led to Li Bai's death sentence being commuted to exile.

description.zh-cn: 道教宗师司马承祯曾称赞李白有“仙风道骨”，对其声誉有所提升。
description.en: The Daoist patriarch Sima Chengzhen praised Li Bai as having the 'air and bone of an immortal,' which enhanced his reputation.

description.zh-cn: 721年，李白拜谒益州长史苏颋，获其称赞“天才英丽，下笔不休”，认为他将来可与司马相如媲美。
description.en: In 721, Li Bai visited Su Ting, the governor of Yizhou, who praised him for his 'brilliant talent and ceaseless writing' and believed he could rival Sima Xiangru in the future.

description.zh-cn: 李白最为敬慕的诗人是谢朓，其诗歌风格，尤其是山水诗，对李白有深刻影响。
description.en: The poet Li Bai admired most was Xie Tiao. His poetic style, especially his landscape poetry, had a profound influence on Li Bai.
